channel.title: Need PCI Video Card
channel.description: Scratch my last post, I need a PCI Video Card, that can run this game [url=http://warrock.gamersfirst.com/index.php]http://warrock.gamersfirst.com/index.php[/url] , and it can run this monitor [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16824001282]http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16824001282[/url] . It would be great if it was a nice one that isn't loud. I would like this to be the best available one, but since they all pretty much suck, I need help picking one. IT NEEDS TO RUN THAT GAME. Please

item.title: Need PCI Video Card
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:3, topic:249508”]http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130289

should work.[/quote]

Thanks for the suggestion, but actually, the PCI card I bought was a 8400 Nvidia, and it can run my favorite FPS game on max settings without shaders, their shaders look like shit anyway.

newegg.com

SPARKLE GeForce 8400 GS DirectX 10 SFPC84GS512U2LP 512MB 64-Bit DDR3 PCI Low...

Buy SPARKLE GeForce 8400 GS DirectX 10 SFPC84GS512U2LP 512MB 64-Bit DDR3 PCI Low Profile Video Card with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

That is the one I bought, its really good for what I need.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 15, 2008, 06:10:09 am[/size][hr][quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:249508”]Good luck finding a decent PCI card. You would be better off to save money and upgrade your whole system. You could probably do it for $300 if you were careful.[/quote]

This is what I did with my Dell XPS 200, I was very unhappy with the SFF case so I took the CPU and ram and the rest cost 300-400 dollars. Now my computer kicks ass.

Read full topic

item.title: Need PCI Video Card
item.dc:creator: @Power_of_Truth Power of Truth
item.description:
@Power_of_Truth wrote:

Don’t even bother with a PCI video card, the bandwidth on the bus (133MB/s) can’t handle any kind of gaming, and is sometimes even worse than on-board graphics. If you really need a new video card, I’d suggest going with a PCI-Express slot, where a full x16 lane is 4GB/s on 1.0 and 8GB/s on 2.0, or buy a motherboard that has one available. If you are really on a budget and can handle playing most low-requirement games (World of Warcraft, HL2-based games, etc) at low settings, you can get a motherboard with an AGP 4x (1067MB/s) or 8x (2133MB/s) slot, but I wouldn’t try as AGP is really showing it’s age.

Personally, if I were stuck with just PCI slots, I’d go ahead and buy a new computer. You’d get more performance out of it than any PCI slot can give you, and you don’t have to pay too much (you can get a new gaming computer with decent specs for under $1000 USD).

If I were to take a stab at making a few suggestions, I’d say go with an ATi HD4670 if you’re just going for games like World of Warcraft or Runescape. Cheap (sub $100) and the same performance as an HD3850 (which as quite a beast in it’s time a few months ago).

I hope my post was helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: Need PCI Video Card
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Good luck finding a decent PCI card. You would be better off to save money and upgrade your whole system. You could probably do it for $300 if you were careful.

Read full topic
